alert.note: Alert for Knox (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 2:35AM EDT until May 02 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Maine, including the following counties, Androscoggin, Cumberland, Franklin, Kennebec, Knox, Lincoln, Oxford, Sagadahoc, Somerset, Waldo and York. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll and Coos. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 235 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. This will likely cause small streams to leave their banks, along with flooding of low lying and typically flood prone areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lewiston, Auburn, Brunswick, Augusta, Waterville, Conway, Bath, Farmington, Belfast and Fairfield.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
